ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Being in recovery gives me security in life
Being in recovery gives me self-confidence
Being in recovery makes me feel sure of myself
Being in recovery gives me security for the future
Being in recovery allows me to face the future with optimism
I try to find out a lot about what being in recovery means to me
I often reflect on what being in recovery means to me
I often think it would be better if I was not in recovery anymore
I often think that being out of recovery would make my life more interesting
In fact, I am debating whether I want to stay in recovery
